chunks.text:
From: James Adams <James.Adams@chalhoub.com> 
Sent: Wednesday, 10 September 2025 1:31 PM
To: Vince Mulé <Vincenzo.Mule@chalhoub.com>; Waqas Ahmad <Waqas.Ahmad@chalhoub.com>
Subject: Re: Gold coin storage 16pcs of 2.5grams gold coins

 

Hi Vince,

 

I agree with Waqas that a bank safety deposit box would be a safer option.  The value of the coins is only about $4,500 though, based on what I could find online- so in this case it is not a major risk if Elizabeth Arden choose to bear this.

 

We could check our insurance policy with Hagop to see what is covered, and also review our agreement with EA for the usage of our safe and the liability.  There should really be a clear policy and document signed with them about what they can store in our safe and who will bear the cost if something happens.

 

Kind regards,

 

JAMES ADAMS

​​​​

VP ‑ TREASURY

M.C.T. FZE

DUBAI

‑

UNITED ARAB EMIRATES

Subject: Re: Gold coin storage 16pcs of 2.5grams gold coins
--------------------------------------------------
Hi Vince,
Hope all is well.
Note that our current insurance policy doesn’t extend to gold coins, bullions, precious metal and similar items. 
However, for this kind of value, the most practical approach would be to store them in one of the office safes that has limited access, ideally just one person.
Remain at your disposal if you require any further assistance.
Best regards,
Hagop
HAGOP GHAZARIAN	
​​​​	
SPECIALIST ‑ ADMINISTRATION	
M.C.T. FZE	
DUBAI

On Sep 10, 2025, at 6:00 PM, Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> wrote:
	
	

	﻿ 
	Hi Vince,
	Hope all is well.
	Note that our current insurance policy doesn’t extend to gold coins, bullions, precious metal and similar items. 
	However, for this kind of value, the most practical approach would be to store them in one of the office safes that has limited access, ideally just one person.
	Remain at your disposal if you require any further assistance.
	Best regards,
	Hagop
HAGOP GHAZARIAN	 
​​​​	 
SPECIALIST ‑ ADMINISTRATION

	Hi Vince,

	 

	I agree with Waqas that a bank safety deposit box would be a safer option.  The value of the coins is only about $4,500 though, based on what I could find online- so in this case it is not a major risk if Elizabeth Arden choose to bear this.

chunks.text:
I agree with Waqas that a bank safety deposit box would be a safer option.  The value of the coins is only about $4,500 though, based on what I could find online- so in this case it is not a major risk if Elizabeth Arden choose to bear this.

	 

	We could check our insurance policy with Hagop to see what is covered, and also review our agreement with EA for the usage of our safe and the liability.  There should really be a clear policy and document signed with them about what they can store in our safe and who will bear the cost if something happens.

	 

	Kind regards,

	 

JAMES ADAMS

​​​​

VP ‑ TREASURY

M.C.T. FZE

DUBAI

‑

UNITED ARAB EMIRATES

+971 4 804 5000
